title: Continental to unveil innovative invisible biometrics sensing display at CES 2025
content: Continental will showcase a new display at CES 2025. The display uses cameras and lasers to monitor passenger health and safety. It can detect vital signs and even check if seatbelts are fastened correctly. This technology is hidden within the display and is invisible to the eye. Continental received a CES Innovation Award for this technology.

title: Trump to push self-driving vehicles in boost to Tesla
content: President-elect Donald Trump's transition team is prioritizing a federal framework for fully self-driving vehicles. This move would benefit Tesla CEO Elon Musk, as Tesla heavily invests in self-driving technology. While the Transportation Department can adjust regulations, Congress's action is needed for mass adoption. Potential policy leaders and a bipartisan legislative measure are under consideration.

title: Allegro MicroSystems expands R&D facility in Hyderabad, boosting Telangana's semiconductor ecosystem
content: Allegro MicroSystems, a global leader in magnetic sensing and power IC solutions, is setting up an R&D facility in Hyderabad. The facility will create 500 jobs. title: Bosch Q2 revenue rises 6.4% to INR 4,394 crore on strong automotive sales
content: Bosch Limited witnessed revenue growth in the second quarter. The company's revenue reached INR 4,394 crores. Sales in passenger cars and off-highway segments drove this growth. The Power Solutions business, a major contributor, grew by 5.7%.  Bosch Limited is optimistic about future growth, anticipating continued demand across segments.

title: Demand for ADAS surges amid growing road safety concerns in India
content: A new survey reveals that Indians are increasingly concerned about road safety. Many Indians have experienced road accidents in recent years. Two-wheeler riders are particularly vulnerable. title: MapmyIndia forms JV with Hyundai Autoever to expand Southeast Asian market
content: MapmyIndia's board approved a joint venture with Hyundai Autoever, where MapmyIndia will hold a 40% stake with a USD 4 million investment.
